title: Ayala 2012 Le Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Produced from fruit grown on the Côte des Blancs, the heart of Chardonnay in Champagne, this wine is both richly mineral and deliciously fruity. Dry and tense, this vintage wine should be aged further. Drink from 2020.

title: Balletto 2016 Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From an estate-grown property, this is acid-driven and beautifully tart, persistent on the palate in whirls of blueberry and boysenberry. It offers the right amount of ripeness for its frame, finishing with complex structure and freshness.
designation: Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Barons de Rothschild NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This Champagne, made for the three Bordeaux winemaking branches of the Rothschild family, is beautifully mature. It has richness, toast and elegance along with hints of brighter fruitiness. Crisply textured at the end while adding acidity to the mix, it is ready to drink.

title: Benovia 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From several of the producer's estate sites, as well as the Zio Tony Ranch farmed by the Martinelli family, this wine exudes rich, velvety blue and black fruit flavors within a context of firm tannins and integrated oak. Dots of white pepper and cardamom complete the complex experience.

title: Boizel 2008 Grand Vintage Brut  (Champagne)
description: Half-and-half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this rich wine is just approaching maturity. Touches of spice and toast contrast beautifully with ripe pear and apple flavors that are crispened with citrus acidity. Although this full wine can be drunk now, it will be best from 2019.

title: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2013  Taurasi
description: Aromas of black cooking spice, dark-skinned berry and blue flower swirl around in the glass. On the palate, firm, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity balance dried black cherry, clove and freshly ground pepper. Drink 2021–2030.

title: Domaine Brochard 2016 Le Cul de Beaujeu  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from a steep, southeast-facing vineyard close to the castle of Beaujeu. Particularly rich, it offers tropical fruits that show strongly through the acidity. There is an urgency to the texture, taut and still young. The wine proves the aging ability of fine Sancerre. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2015 Clos du Château Paladi  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine comes from a small walled vineyard next to a townhouse with little towers, called locally in jest Château Paladi. Ripe with apple and lime fruits, the wine is crisply textured and balanced, with a flinty character. It is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2016 Ammonites  (Sancerre)
description: Named after the shells that are the basis of the chalk soil of Sancerre, this wine is ripe and full. The aging in large wooden barrels has softened the shock of Sauvignon Blanc, resulting in a citrus and apple-flavored wine that is now ready to drink.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Back Yard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The overall balance and underlying minerality in this wine are a good start, indicating a wine that is built to last. There's a delicate aspect to the brambly fruit, plus hidden seams of lemon curd and salted caramel. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Parker West Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Ripe black cherry kicks off the nose of this bottling from the family's westernmost property, but then comes the more elegant touches of clove, chaparral and bay leaf. The palate is savory and complex, showing shiitake mushroom, sour cherry, ripe cranberry and a pinch of oregano.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Feudi Studi Candriano  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, blue flower, forest floor, smoke and a whiff of cocoa come together in this wine. The velvety palate shows nice tension, delivering black cherry, blackberry, licorice and tobacco set against taut, fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. A flinty mineral note energizes the tight finish. Give this time to come around to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2024–2032.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Piano di Montevergine  (Taurasi)
description: Menthol, tobacco, blackberry and dark, exotic spice aromas slowly take shape. On the firmly structured palate, tense, fine-grained tannins support black cherry, licorice and clove. It's still young and tight, so give it plenty of time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.

title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Oger Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This wine is one of a trilogy of individual village wines from the Côte des Blancs. It is just moving out of youth and growing up, hinting at the toastiness to come. However, it has kept its intense minerality from the chalk soil of the Côte des Blancs. Drink this structured wine from 2020.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens thick and rich, but evolves to show an underlying spark of brightness that persists through the midpalate and onto the finish. Raspberry and sage contrast against each other as a fleshy element of wild strawberry comes into play.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2014 Piocho Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very plump aromas of dark strawberry, lilacs, jasmine and a hint of gingerbread show on the nose of this blend of 33% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc, 7% Malbec and 7% Petit Verdot. The elegant palate rolls out flavors of candied raspberry, elderflower and black plum, growing more intense with acidity and tannins into the finish.

title: Joseph Mellot 2015 La Grande Châtelaine  (Sancerre)
description: Lightly and judiciously wood aged, this wine is smooth, rounded with a poised balance between its acidity and generous yellow fruits. The period of wood and then bottle aging has softened and filled out the fruit, giving the wine a ripe character. Drink now.

title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This study of Clone 2A begins with big aromas of boysenberry jam, black tea and minty chocolate elements. There is decent weight to the palate, where rich and ripe flavors of blackberry meet with firm tannins and buoyant acidity. Dashes of star anise and all spice give further depth.

title: Kracher 2017 Auslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)
description: Hints of creamiest vanilla and caramelized pear stream generously from the glass. The palate deepens these impressions with almost emollient force. All of this encompassing richness is countered by wonderfully sharp freshness and a tingling background of peppery, almost nettly spice. Such lovely balance and such lasting savor!

title: Lallier NV Les Sous Sélection Parcellaire Grand Cru Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: Made with ripe Pinot Noir from Aÿ on the southern slopes of the Montagne de Reims, this is full of warm apple and pear flavors, cut with generous acidity, finishing with a mineral tautness. The wine is ready to drink.
designation: Les Sous Sélection Parcellaire Grand Cru Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut
